description:
Was doing some diagnosis of why snapshotting was failing in TryStack.

Looking into the Nova database, the snapshots table is entirely empty, but strangely, the dashboard shows snpahosts, always in a Queued state.

So, I grabbed the UUID of the instance that I was trying to snapshot and logged in the compute node that was housing the node (freecloud102).

I then grepped for the instance UUID and found this ERROR in the compute log:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/9778/

Looks like a bunch of gobbledeegook, but if you look closely, you wlll see that the payload that is attempting to be serialized into a notification message contains this:

{'db': u"<module 'nova.db.api' from '/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/db/api.pyc'>"}, 'driver': {'read_only': False, '_wrapped_conn': {'_o': <capsule object "virConnectPtr" at 0x4c63930>}

Which is not JSON-serializable in the notification message and thus causes the ERROR to come up.

I'm not sure if that error is masking the qemu-img convert error or whether the qemu-img convert error is in relation to the JSON serialization thing?
title: DIABLO - Snapshotting in libvirt/KVM failing due to JSON errors

comments.content:
Was doing some diagnosis of why snapshotting was failing in TryStack.

Looking into the Nova database, the snapshots table is entirely empty, but strangely, the dashboard shows snpahosts, always in a Queued state.

So, I grabbed the UUID of the instance that I was trying to snapshot and logged in the compute node that was housing the node (freecloud102).

I then grepped for the instance UUID and found this ERROR in the compute log:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/9778/

Looks like a bunch of gobbledeegook, but if you look closely, you wlll see that the payload that is attempting to be serialized into a notification message contains this:

{'db': u"<module 'nova.db.api' from '/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/db/api.pyc'>"}, 'driver': {'read_only': False, '_wrapped_conn': {'_o': <capsule object "virConnectPtr" at 0x4c63930>}

Which is not JSON-serializable in the notification message and thus causes the ERROR to come up.

I'm not sure if that error is masking the qemu-img convert error or whether the qemu-img convert error is in relation to the JSON serialization thing?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content: Does the DIABLO prefix in the bug title mean it's diablo-only, or that it affects diablo for sure and maybe also Essex ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: No, it means I have not reproduced this on Essex code... but I see it easily on Diablo code. Then again, I only have TryStack running Diablo right now...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content: Conservatively keeping open for Essex, just in case.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
The paste linked from the bug is gone.  :-(  I suspect this is no longer an issue since so much has changed since Diablo, so I'm going to close it out.

On a related note, most serialization errors we see are because we try to pass in a db model.  We've got a couple of things that are making this much less of an issue:

1) We've got jsonutils.to_primitive() that can convert db models to primitive types for serialization.  In the case of kombu, it will be invoked automatically if a json serialization problem is encountered.  Soon, that will be the case for all rpc backends.

2) There is an effort in progress to make it so the db layer stops returning db models and returns dicts instead.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb
